decks.notes: The deck revolves around cycling through cards to fill up the graveyard with creatures, then casting Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. Shardless Agent and Subtlety help manipulate the top of the deck and cycle through cards efficiently. Endurance and Striped Riverwinder can be cycled for free to fill up the graveyard. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden influx of creatures and win through board presence. Force of Negation and Commandeer provide disruption against opposing strategies, while Misty Rainforest helps fetch needed lands.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Amulet Titan combo by using cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and Explore to quickly ramp up mana and play powerful lands like Vesuva and Urza's Saga. Additionally, cards like Scapeshift and Summoner's Pact help to search for key pieces of the combo. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Mirrorpool to provide additional control and options. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and abilities.

This deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures and colorless spells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing the UrzaTron lands and Expedition Map, the deck aims to quickly assemble the three Urza lands to generate mana for devastating plays. Chalice of the Void and All is Dust help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while powerful creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional threats and disruption. The deck's key strategy is to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent through counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures. It seeks to control the game by countering key spells, removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes card draw and graveyard recursion to maintain card advantage and generate value. The win condition revolves around playing a threat like Murktide Regent or building up incremental advantage with creatures like Psychic Frog. The mana base is optimized for Esper colors, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and ensuring consistency in mana sources.

This deck is focused on generating a high amount of mana through cards like Pyretic Ritual and Ruby Medallion in order to cast spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot to quickly defeat the opponent. The deck also utilizes Past in Flames to effectively cast spells from the graveyard, as well as Wish and Valakut Awakening to search for key combo pieces. The inclusion of cards like Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible help with card draw and digging for important combo pieces to execute the win condition efficiently.

The focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse, in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Devourer of Destiny and Sowing Mycospawn provide additional threats and board presence. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big, hard-to-answer threats while maintaining control of the game through resource management and disruption.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift to deal massive damage to the opponent in one turn. It utilizes cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder, Farseek, and Green Sun's Zenith to accelerate mana production, along with creatures like Primeval Titan and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to further enhance the Valakut combo. The inclusion of cards like Endurance and Boseiju, Who Endures provide protection and utility against specific threats. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with a devastating Valakut trigger.
